snippet: The State Department said it had been quietly offering rewards of up to $10 million for information about last year’s attack on an American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.
abstract: State Department says that since January 2013 it has been quietly offering rewards of up to $10 million for information leading to arrest or conviction of anyone involved in 2012 attack on American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.
lead_paragraph: The State Department said it had been quietly offering rewards of up to $10 million for information about last year’s attack on an American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.

headline.main: Libya: U.S. Offers Rewards in Benghazi
headline.print_headline: Libya: U.S. Offers Rewards in Benghazi
